title: 106_hr2097
content:
The Act is titled the "U.S.S. New Jersey Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings. The U.S.S. New Jersey was launched in 1942 and served for nearly 50 years before decommissioning in 1991. It played a key role in various operations during World War II and the Korean War. The U.S.S. New Jersey served as the flagship for Commander 7th Fleet during the Korean War. It was reactivated in 1968 as the only active-duty Navy battleship and provided major-caliber fire support during the Vietnam conflict. The battleship was decommissioned in December 1969 but was called back to active duty in 1982 for missions off the coast of Nicaragua and in the Mediterranean. The U.S.S. New Jersey provided critical fire support in Beirut, Lebanon in 1983 and continued serving in various roles, including deployments in the Western Pacific. It was decommissioned for the final time in February 1991, and in 1998 Congress passed legislation to permanently berth the ship in New Jersey. The state strongly supports bringing the U.S.S. New Jersey home, with the congressional delegation united in its support. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS.

In honor of the U.S.S. New Jersey, the Secretary of the Treasury will mint up to 500,000 $1 coins, each weighing 26.73 grams, with a diameter of 1.500 inches, and containing 90% silver and 10% copper. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items.

SEC. 4. SOURCES OF BULLION.

The Secretary can obtain silver for minting these coins from any available source, including stockpiles under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act.

SEC. 5. DESIGN OF COINS. The design of the coins minted under this Act shall be emblematic of the U.S.S. New Jersey's service, with specific inscriptions and a likeness of the ship on the obverse. The Secretary will consider elements from the ship's Navy service in the design. The design for the coins minted under this Act will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Coin Advisory Committee. SEC. 6. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single Mint facility during the period from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2002. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coins, a surcharge of $10 per coin, and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount on sale prices. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. 10 percent of surcharge proceeds from coin sales under this Act will be paid to the U.S.S. New Jersey Battleship Foundation in Middletown, New Jersey for moving and berthing the U.S.S. New Jersey. The Foundation will be audited as per title 31, United States Code.
